assessments.approved_by: Dr. Katharina Meier, Chief Sustainability Officer

iro_items.title: GHG Emissions from Manufacturing Operations and Value Chain
iro_items.description: Direct and indirect greenhouse gas emissions arising from energy-intensive manufacturing processes (steel forming, polymer extrusion, CHP operation) and upstream supply chain activities, primarily steel and chemical procurement.

evidence_links.description: Transition plan for climate change mitigation
Substantial contribution to climate change mitigation

iro_items.key_findings: Steel and aluminium procurement accounts for 38% of total Scope 3. CBAM exposure estimated at EUR 45M annually by 2027. Energy cost volatility creates EUR 80-120M EBITDA risk under IEA NZE scenario.

iro_items.title: Physical Climate Risk to Manufacturing Sites and Supply Chains
iro_items.description: Chronic and acute physical climate risks affecting production continuity, particularly flooding risk at Rhine-adjacent facilities and heat stress impacts on polymer processing yields.

evidence_links.description: Actions and resources for climate policies
Anticipated financial effects from physical risks

iro_items.key_findings: 2021 Rhine flooding caused EUR 12M in direct losses at Duisburg site. Climate projections indicate 40% increase in extreme precipitation events by 2040 in NRW region. Heat waves reduce polymer extrusion yields by 3-7%.

iro_items.esrs_sub_topic: E2-4 / Pollution of Air, Water, Soil
iro_items.title: Industrial Pollutant Emissions from Manufacturing Processes
iro_items.description: Emissions of NOx, SOx, particulate matter, and VOCs from combustion processes, surface treatment, and painting operations. Includes potential soil contamination at legacy sites.
iro_items.key_findings: NOx emissions at 1,240 tonnes/year across 4 German sites. Three facilities subject to IED BAT-AEL compliance by 2026. Legacy contamination remediation provision of EUR 18M for Duisburg-Hamborn site.

iro_items.title: Water Consumption in Manufacturing and Cooling Processes
iro_items.description: Significant water withdrawal for cooling in metal forming, polymer processing, and CHP operations. Facilities in water-stressed regions (Puebla-MX, Shanghai-CN) face medium-term supply constraints.
iro_items.key_findings: Total water withdrawal 8.2M cubic meters/year. Puebla and Shanghai sites in WRI 'High' baseline water stress zones (combined 22% of withdrawal). Closed-loop cooling investment of EUR 6M planned for 2025.

iro_items.title: Biodiversity Impacts from Land Use and Supply Chain Raw Materials
iro_items.description: Direct land use impacts at manufacturing sites adjacent to protected areas, and indirect biodiversity impacts through upstream mining and forestry supply chains.

evidence_links.description: Targets for protecting and restoring nature

iro_items.key_findings: Two sites within 5km of Natura 2000 areas. TNFD LEAP assessment initiated Q3 2024. Upstream bauxite and iron ore supply chains carry moderate deforestation risk via Brazilian sources.

iro_items.esrs_sub_topic: E5-1 / Resource Use and Circular Economy
iro_items.title: Material Circularity and Waste Reduction in Manufacturing
iro_items.description: Opportunities and risks related to transitioning to circular manufacturing models, including increasing recycled content in products, reducing production waste, and designing for disassembly.

evidence_links.description: Policies related to resource use and circular economy

evidence_links.ref: EU PPWR (Packaging and Packaging Waste Regulation)

iro_items.key_findings: Current recycled content at 31% (target 55% by 2030). Production waste at 48,000 tonnes/year with 78% diversion rate. EU PPWR mandates create EUR 25M compliance investment need. Circular revenue opportunities estimated at EUR 180M by 2028.

iro_items.title: Occupational Health and Safety in Manufacturing Environments
iro_items.description: Worker health and safety risks across heavy manufacturing operations including metal forming, chemical handling, and high-temperature polymer processing.
iro_items.key_findings: LTIR at 1.8 per million hours worked (industry benchmark 2.1). Three facilities ISO 45001 certified. Chemical exposure incidents declined 34% since 2022 through engineering controls. Target zero fatal accidents maintained since 2019.

iro_items.title: Workforce Reskilling for Green Manufacturing Transition
iro_items.description: Strategic need to reskill workforce for EV component manufacturing, digital twin operations, and circular economy processes as traditional ICE automotive demand declines.
iro_items.key_findings: 12,000 employees (29%) in ICE-dependent roles requiring transition pathways. EUR 34M annual training budget, 28 hours/employee average. Partnership with RWTH Aachen on EV manufacturing certification program enrolling 2,400 workers.

iro_items.title: Anti-Corruption and Ethical Business Practices in Global Operations
iro_items.description: Governance risks associated with operations in jurisdictions with elevated corruption risk indices, including supply chain due diligence under German LkSG and EU CSDDD.

evidence_links.description: Business conduct policies and corporate culture
Prevention and detection of corruption and bribery

evidence_links.ref: German LkSG (Supply Chain Due Diligence Act)
evidence_links.description: Human rights and environmental due diligence obligations

evidence_links.ref: EU CSDDD (Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive)

iro_items.key_findings: LkSG compliance achieved since Jan 2023. 94% of Tier-1 suppliers completed due diligence questionnaire. Two substantiated whistleblower cases resolved in 2024. EUR 2.1M invested in compliance management system upgrade.

iro_items.title: Political Engagement and Industry Association Lobbying Alignment
iro_items.description: Potential misalignment between corporate climate commitments and trade association lobbying positions on EU climate legislation (ETS reform, CBAM, PPWR).
iro_items.key_findings: Member of 14 industry associations. InfluenceMap alignment score C+. BDI and VDA membership positions partially misaligned with Paris Agreement targets on ETS free allocation phase-out timeline.

key_themes: GHG emissions from steel/aluminium supply chain and energy-intensive manufacturing dominate materiality
Circular economy transition presents significant dual materiality as both impact reduction and revenue opportunity
Workforce transformation for EV/green manufacturing creates strategic financial risk requiring proactive investment
Physical climate risk increasingly material for Rhine-corridor manufacturing operations
